title: Peru Two drugs mule Michaella McCollum returns to Spain four years after hatching drug-smuggling plot in Ibiza
text:
BACK TO THE SCENE OF THE CRIME Peru Two drugs mule Michaella McCollum returns to Spain four years after hatching drug-smuggling plot in Ibiza 
She was spotted walking along a beach in the country on Wednesday By KATHRYN CAIN Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments PERU Two drugs mule Michaella McCollum has been pictured sunning herself on a beach in Spain – the first time she has visited the country since smuggling cocaine out of Majorca four years ago. 
The 23-year-old was spotted on Wednesday walking along golden sands in Spain and enjoying herself in the sea. iCelebTV Peru Two drugs mule Michaella McCollum has been spotted at a beach in Spain iCelebTV It is the first time she has been back to the country since smuggling cocaine to Peru four years ago iCelebTV McCollum returned home to Ireland six months ago after spending three years in prison in Peru iCelebTV 16 On Wednesday she was seen walking along a beach in Spain 
The model spent three years inside a mosquito-infested cell with seven other women for the offence. 
McCollum, one half of the notorious “Peru Two” along with accomplice Melissa Reid , broke her silence after having returned home to Northern Ireland last year. iCelebTV Wearing a tiny black bikini the 23-year-old strolled along the sand and went in the water iCelebTV Flashing her tanned skin the model even went for a jog along the beach iCelebTV Appearing to feel a chill she put on a black patterned wrap iCelebTV 16 Shortly afterwards she was spotted walking along the street and past local cafes 
She took to Facebook and wrote: “It has been a long ride to get where I am today but it just shows that when we fight hard enough for something we can achieve it. 
“Something to have in mind; when one door closes, another opens; but we often look so long and so regretfully upon the closed door that we do not see the one which has opened for us.” 
She added: “Now that I have the chance, I just want to thank everyone who has supported myself and family through these past few years. Please know I truly appreciate each one who cared and had my back.” CASCADE NEWS Drugs mule Michaella was so terrified of her gangster inmates she worried she’d be eaten alive Facebook She was jailed after trying to smuggle cocaine worth £1.5million onto a plane 

Previously reflecting on her time behind bars now that she’s back home with her family, McCollum confessed to The Mirror: “What I went through was completely my fault – and I lost three years of my life. “You get an adrenaline high because you’re doing something you know you shouldn’t be doing. 
“No one put a gun to my head.” Coke arrest girls in Peru Reuters Melissa Reid and Michaella McCollum, the Peru Two, initially lied and said they had been forced to smuggle the drugs EFE McCollum received six years and eight months, which was eventually cut short British girls try to explain their drugs arrest in Peru 
McCollum has said she was on a four-day ketamine and magic mushroom-fuelled bender in Ibiza when she decided to smuggle cocaine into Spain. 
After a “Cockney guy Jake” offered to help her make money, she agreed and began her £4,000 task. 
She met fellow mule Reid in Majorca at the airport, and the pair flew to Lima posing as tourists, even visiting popular tourist destination Machu Picchu as part of the ruse. AP:Associated Press Michaella McCollum Connolly, left, and Melissa Reid, stand behind their luggage after being detained at the airport in Lima, Peru 
They then picked up 32 packets of cocaine and packed them inside their suitcases. 
The pair didn’t get far however – a plain-clothes police officer searched their bags at Lima’s Jorge Chavez International Airport, and the gig was up. 
After realising she could end up in jail for 15 years if found guilty, McCollum came clean, admitting she had not been forced to carry the drugs. Getty Images Caught red-handed ... McCollum and Reid eventually admitted they agreed to smuggle the drugs of their own accord, and were handed lighter sentences Splash Pix She was allowed to return to her home in Northern Ireland six months ago Drug smuggler Michaella McCollum celebrates her 23rd birthday in Lima 
Her honesty paid off – she received six years and eight months instead, which was cut short. 
As she gained the loyalty of her fellow prisoners, McCollum also received romantic attention from men and women alike. 
She claims she received nearly 500 love letters in her time at the jail – and one marriage proposal. 
Another enamoured admirer sent her eight kittens, which she was forced to give back.
